conclusion: Analyze forces acting on suitcase and use equilibrium conditions to find angle θ and friction coefficient μ.
Identify forces: weight W = mg = 150 N, normal force N, tension F = 90 N, frictional force f = μN.
Resolve pull into components: horizontal F cos θ, vertical F sin θ.
Vertical equilibrium: N + F sin θ = W, thus N = W - F sin θ.
Horizontal equilibrium: F cos θ = μN.
Substitute N from vertical equilibrium into horizontal: F cos θ = μ(W - F sin θ).
Rearrange to solve for μ: F (cos θ + μ sin θ) = μW.
Equation in μ and θ: 90 (cos θ + μ sin θ) = μ × 150.
Minimum pull occurs when horizontal pull component equals frictional force: F cos θ = μN.
Substitute N = 150 - 90 sin θ: 90 cos θ = μ(150 - 90 sin θ).
Equation: 90 cos θ + 90 μ sin θ = 150 μ.
Equation: (3/5)(cos θ + μ sin θ) = μ.
Find θ by solving equation directly or using trial and error: θ = 37° satisfies equation.
Substitute θ = 37° into equation to find μ.
